channel.title: Exp
channel.description: Well, the answer to this is probably very simple but I cannot seem to figure it out, I fixed the exp rates for my combat skills BUT I need to know how to change the exp rates on non-combat skills, EX: Runecrafting. Whenever I try to change the exp rates on Runecrafting so that training it goes slower nothing happens, I asked a friend and he told me to edit the cases; well I went to the case for the Nature Altar and found nothing having to do with exp. If anybody could help me out on changing exp rates for non-combat skills, it'd be greatly appreciated.

item.title: Exp
item.dc:creator: @Ibehustlin247 Ibehustlin247
item.description:
@Ibehustlin247 wrote:

Thanks alot, I got it.

Read full topic

item.title: Exp
item.dc:creator: @veikron veikron
item.description:
@veikron wrote:

What I do is… Lets say the the thing that is non combat like the altar id is 5555 (its not) then you search 5555 if its something like a stall it will say case 5555 under it add skillxp 1700 change the skill exp to lower if its not in a case then just search it or an item used on it youll see “add skillxp” change the number by that

Read full topic

item.title: Exp
item.dc:creator: @Ibehustlin247 Ibehustlin247
item.description:
@Ibehustlin247 wrote:

Thanks alot, im going to try it now.

Read full topic

item.title: Exp
item.dc:creator: @pk3r_john pk3r john
item.description:
@pk3r_john wrote:

OK, this is a little harder than Cmbt xp.

What you want to do is go into your client.java and search for the skill you want to edit.
EX: Woodcutting

I would search “woodcutting” and i’d get a bunch of wc stuff.
its different for every server so just do that and scroll down until you find the exp for it and then save, compile, and run and your done

Read full topic
